alert.note: Alert for Loudon; McMinn; Meigs; NW Blount; Northwest Monroe; Rhea (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 12:58AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN RHEA...LOUDON... CENTRAL MEIGS...NORTHERN MCMINN...WEST CENTRAL BLOUNT AND NORTHWESTERN MONROE COUNTIES THROUGH 245 AM EDT... At 158 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Decatur, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Athens, Lenoir City, Sweetwater, Loudon, Madisonville, Decatur, Vonore, Greenback, Friendsville, and Niota. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Morristown. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for east Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Loudon; McMinn; Meigs; NW Blount; Northwest Monroe; Rhea
